question: More children in developed countries are becoming overweight. This is serious problem for wealthy countries. Discuss some causes and effects of these problems
text: It has been observed in recent times that obesity is becoming a serious problem in various developed nations. Many children in these countries are putting on weight which affects their health. This essay will throw light on its possible causes and effects of it.

To commence with, there are many factors which are responsible for it. Firstly, every child is consuming junk food which affects their physical health. Parents also prefer to eat outside instead of cooking at home due to their hectic work schedules. To exemplify it, a growing number of children are eating fast foods, such as burgers and pizza due to the fact they find them tastier than homemade items. Secondly, they are reluctant to perform any kind of physical activity and exercise.

Moving to its next, there are numerous effects of this problem. Initially, Overweight kids are more prone to attract medical issues rather than normal ones. In other words, it badly affects their body and makes them unfit to perform any task. For example, In the USA, youngsters are suffering from medical ailments like Diabetes and Thyroid due to their obesity. In addition to it, this issue also creates a negative impact on mental health as well. For instance, youth across the world is having anxiety and stress-related issues due to that.

To conclude, I would like to reiterate that there are so many causes of it and it grows at an alarming rate. In addition to it, it can pose a big threat in future if not paid attention to it. Thus, there is a need to take collective measures in order to solve this concern. Guardians and government should promote and create awareness  about healthy foodstuffs. Moreover, Gyming and other exercises can also be a better solution to this.
